Class GameLoop

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.tetris.game.GameLoop
public class GameLoop extends Object
Manages the main game loop using JavaFX Timeline animation. The GameLoop executes a tick action at regular intervals to update the game state (typically moving the falling brick down).

This class provides methods to:

  • Start, pause, resume, and stop the game loop
  • Dynamically update the tick interval for speed changes
See Also:
  • AnimationHandler

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLoop

      public GameLoop(javafx.util.Duration interval, Runnable tickAction)
      Constructs a new GameLoop with the specified tick interval and action.
      Parameters:
      interval - the duration between each tick
      tickAction - the action to execute on each tick
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if tickAction is null

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the game loop from the beginning. If the loop was previously running, it restarts from time zero.

    • resume

      public void resume()
      Resumes the game loop from where it was paused.

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pauses the game loop without resetting the timeline.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the game loop completely.

    • updateInterval

      public void updateInterval(javafx.util.Duration newInterval)
      Updates the tick interval while preserving the running state. If the loop was running, it continues running at the new speed.
      Parameters:
      newInterval - the new duration between ticks
